item.title: Kaúla Sabélina
item.description: Overview Kaúla Sabélina1 was a neolithic settlement inhabited by the Diiran minikin, and one of southern Tseireph’s first proto-cities. It was a large settlement built around a temple, and was an important religious site in the Diiran religion.

item.title: The Diiran Minikin
item.description: Overview The Diira were a Nethic tribe of minikin native to the Sarvaran River Basin in southern Tseireph, in the 2nd realm during the neolithic period.
